task_summary: Robot reaches toward the pink towel using visual perception to locate it, then approaches and aligns at the towel, verifying arrival.

task_long_description.overview: This episode features a bimanual robot arm tasked with reaching a pink towel placed on a green field. The robot starts away from the towel and progressively moves toward it using reliable visual perception action. The main object involved is the towel, and the robot's role is to approach and visually verify its arrival at the target. The sequence proceeds with detecting the towel, approaching, and ensuring alignment for a successful reach. Constraints include limited workspace and accurate perception.
preconditions: Towel is present and visible somewhere in workspace
Robot arms begin in a default home or standby pose
No obstacles block the route to the towel
stepwise_plan: Visually verify or scan for the towel
Approach and align toward the towel using pose feedback
Check that the robot is at the towel
success_criteria: Robot is visually and pose-wise at the towel
failure_and_recovery: Failure to perceive towel: retry scan action
Pose misalignment: re-approach action could be invoked
Unexpected obstruction: abort and reset episode
task_long_description.termination: Task ends once robot verifies arrival at the towel via IsAt condition.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

node_specs.description: Checks if towel is visually perceived by the robot.
Visually scans the workspace for the towel with up to 3 attempts.
Runs a targeted detection routine to localize the towel.
Moves and aligns end-effector with the towel to within a tight tolerance.
Checks if the robot's relevant TCP is positioned at the towel.

recovery_strategy: Repeat scan to reacquire towel if perception fails
Retry approach if not at towel after first attempt
assumptions: Instruction only asked for a reach, frames suggest no grasping or transfer; design keeps to reach only.
Workspace visible and unobstructed throughout all frames.
No evidence of picking nor placing, so corresponding nodes omitted.

expected_success_criteria: Robot's end-effector arrives and is confirmed at the towel; no grasp or manipulation occurs.
